title: SCS RTVF 375-CN-65 Designing for the Internet

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This studio course will cover the principles of graphic design as they apply to the interactive world of the web. Sensitivity to the visual elements of online interfaces will be developed through analysis of existing site designs and readings. Technologies such as (but not limited to) Dreamweaver, HTML/CSS, and Photoshop will be introduced through a series of exercises and assignments. Students will use these skills to conceive and create their own web-based final project. Students should be familiar with Macintosh or Windows operating systems. Carries science credit.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Familiarity with the Macintosh or Windows operating system.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will be able to understand the process of designing and creating a website

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Demonstrations, Presentations, Readings, Lectures, Discussions, Videos

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Required software will be available in lab. USB-compatible portable storage device. Texts for this class will be provided on Canvas or found online.

subject: RTVF
